CLINIC NOTE

Patient: [REDACTED], a 67-year-old male
DOB: [REDACTED]
SSN: [REDACTED]
MRN: [REDACTED]
Phone: [REDACTED]
Address: [REDACTED]

CHIEF COMPLAINT: Follow-up for type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension.

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:
Patient presents for routine 3-month follow-up. He reports good compliance with metformin 1000mg twice daily and lisinopril 20mg daily. Home blood glucose readings range from 110-145 mg/dL fasting. He denies polyuria, polydipsia, blurred vision, or numbness/tingling in extremities. Blood pressure home readings average 132/78 mmHg.

MEDICATIONS:
1. Metformin 1000mg PO BID
2. Lisinopril 20mg PO daily
3. Atorvastatin 40mg PO QHS
4. Aspirin 81mg PO daily

VITAL SIGNS:
BP: 134/80 mmHg | HR: 72 bpm | Temp: 98.4F | SpO2: 98% RA | Weight: 198 lbs

LABORATORY RESULTS (drawn 2025-05-28):
- HbA1c: 7.1% (prior 7.4%)
- Fasting glucose: 128 mg/dL
- Creatinine: 1.0 mg/dL, eGFR >60
- Microalbumin/Cr ratio: 18 mg/g (normal)
- Lipid panel: TC 185, LDL 98, HDL 45, TG 155

ASSESSMENT AND PLAN:
1. Type 2 diabetes mellitus - improving control, HbA1c trending down. Continue current regimen. Recheck HbA1c in 3 months. Annual diabetic eye exam due.
2. Hypertension - at goal. Continue lisinopril 20mg daily.
3. Hyperlipidemia - LDL near goal. Continue atorvastatin 40mg.
4. Health maintenance - influenza vaccine administered today. Colonoscopy due, referral placed.

Return to clinic in 3 months.

Electronically signed by [REDACTED]
NPI: [REDACTED]
